Description.val: Reconnaissance Support Equipment supports multiple capabilities, enhancements, life cycle replacements, and personnel equipment shortfalls when required and as needed by reconnaissance units throughout operating forces for airborne/parachuting programs, specialized reconnaissance programs and underwater reconnaissance capability programs.  Programs such as:  Airborne Reconnaissance Equipment (ARE) program -- a roll-up line with multiple specialized raid projects, such as, parachuting equipment used for reconnaissance in support of Marine Air Ground Task Force (MAGTF) operations; Aerial Delivery and Autonomous Distribution (A2D2) Family of Systems (formerly Joint Precision Air Drop System (JPADS)) program -- provides capability for increased air carrier survivability, ground accuracy, standoff delivery, and improved effectiveness and assessment feedback for airdrop missions with procurement of parachute delivery systems consisting of a decelerator (parachute) guided by an Autonomous Guidance Unit attached to a Container Delivery System that interfaces with cargo aircraft for autonomous delivery of airborne cargo from high altitudes and lateral separation to predetermined small drop zones; Amphibious Reconnaissance Capability program (formerly Underwater Reconnaissance Capability (URC))-- an overarching Family of Systems which sustains/enhances/supports capabilities of current and future combatant diving systems and small craft as needed and when required by the fleet such as Enhanced Combat Rubber Reconnaissance Craft (ECRRC), Autonomous Hydrographic Coastal Survey (AHCS), Open Water Safety Craft (OWSC), Underwater Breathing Apparatus (UBA), Combatant Diver Full Face Mask (CDFFM), Combatant Diver Vest (CDV), Expeditionary Hyperbaric Chamber System (EHCS), Transportable recompression Chamber System (TRCS), Combat Dry Diver Suit (CDDS), Maritime Operations Suit (MOS), Portable Compressor Diesel Driven (PCDD), Rapid Deployable Oxygen Transfer Pump System (RDOTPS), Non-gasoline Burning Outboard Engine (NBOE), and the Diver Reconnaissance Vehicle (DRV), Diver Propulsion Device (DPD), Enhanced Diver Propulsion Device (E-DPD), Marine Individual Assault Kit (MIAK), Marine Assault Breacher's Kit (MABK)in support of MAGTF expeditionary operations.  LRUSV program is an autonomous 11 meter boat, which has the capability for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV), Unmanned Undersea Vehicle (UUV) and Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV).  Aerial Delivery and Autonomous Distribution (A2D2) is a level of effort program that will provide increased capability and survivability for airborne cargo.

Justification.val:
FY 2019:  $14.890M
Airborne Reconnaissance Equipment: $3.606M (Active - $3.407, Reserves - $0.199M) - Funding supported the procurement of the Enhanced Multi Mission Parachute Systems (E-MMPS).   

Amphibious Reconnaissance Capability: $11.284M (Active - $11.284M, Reserves - $0.000M) - Funding supported the procurement of Combat Rubber Reconnaissance Craft.  Congressional Plus-Up funding of $9.600M supports Enhanced Diver Propulsion Device.

FY 2020:  $7.101M
Airborne Reconnaissance Equipment: $2.921M (Active - $2.717M, Reserves - $0.204M) - Funding supports the procurement of the Enhanced Multi Mission Parachute Systems (E-MMPS).  

Aerial and Autonomous Distribution:  $1.479M (Active - $1.479, Reserves - $0.000M) - Funding provides for the initial procurement of the Aerial Delivery and Autonomous Distribution (A2D2)/Advanced Cargo Parachute Release System (ACPRS) to include upgrading/refreshing parachute oxygen system, cybernetic parachute release replacement, and high-altitude high-opening navigation system.  ACPRS is a replacement for the obsolete M-1 release inside the Heavy Equipment Aerial Delivery System. The decrease in funding from FY20 to FY21 of $1.479M is due to Marine Corps decision to further support the development of Unmanned Logistic Systems - Air Autonomy(ULSA). 

Amphibious Reconnaissance Capability: $2.701M (Active - $2.701M, Reserves - $0.000M) - Funding supports the procurement of Combat Rubber Reconnaissance Craft and procurement of Amphibious Reconnaissance Capability Family of Systems equipment such as, the Marine Assault Breacher's Kit and the Marine Individual Assault Kit for diving configuration and to sustain, enhance, and support capabilities of current and future combatant diving systems and small craft. 

FY 2021 Base Appropriations Request:  $5.752M
Airborne Reconnaissance Equipment: $3.016M (Active - $2.808M, Reserves - $0.208M) - Funding will continue to support the procurement of the Enhanced Multi Mission Parachute Systems (E-MMPS).  

Amphibious Reconnaissance Capability: $2.736M (Active - $2.736M, Reserves - $0.000M) - Funding will support procurement of Enhanced Diver Propulsion Device (E-DPD) and procurement of Amphibious Reconnaissance Capability Family of Systems equipment such as, the Marine Assault Breacher's Kit and the Marine Individual Assault Kit for diving configuration and to sustain, enhance, and support capabilities of current and future combatant diving systems and small craft. 

The decrease in funding from FY20 to FY21 of $1.349M is to further ULS-A prototyping efforts to inform development and fielding in FY22-FY25.

Name.@footnote: Advanced Cargo Parachute Release System (ACPRS) is a replacement for the obsolete M-1 release inside the Heavy Equipment Aerial Delivery System.  The decrease in funding from FY20 to FY21 of $1.479M is due to Marine Corps decision to further support the development of Unmanned Logistic Systems - Air Autonomy(ULSA).

Name.val: 3) Amphibious Reconnaissance Capability - formerly Underwater Reconnaissance Capability (URC)

Name.@footnote: Overarching family of systems line includes various quantities of multiple dive and boat systems, components, and ancillary equipment as needed to sustain/enhance amphibious capability.  Funding is used to support legacy items with known and unknown modifications identified during the year of execution.
